value.description: The maximum number of HTTP requests that can be outstanding at any one time. Any attempt to register an additional HTTP Request will cause an error
value.name: Maximum Outstanding Requests

value.description: Specifies how long an HTTP Request should be left unanswered before being evicted from the cache and being responded to with a Service Unavailable status code
value.name: Request Expiration

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.description: The character set to use for decoding URL parameters if the HTTP Request does not supply one
value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.description: Allow HTTP GET Method
value.name: Allow GET

value.description: Allow HTTP POST Method
value.name: Allow POST

value.description: Allow HTTP PUT Method
value.name: Allow PUT

value.description: Allow HTTP DELETE Method
value.name: Allow DELETE

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method
value.name: Allow HEAD

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.description: A comma-separated list of non-standard HTTP Methods that should be allowed
value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'Content-Type' HTTP Header
value.name: Content-Type

value.description: The AWS Role ARN for cross account access. This is used in conjunction with role name and session timeout
value.name: Assume Role ARN

value.description: The aws role name for cross account access. This is used in conjunction with role arn and session time out
value.name: Assume Role Session Name

value.description: Session time for role based session (between 900 and 3600 seconds). This is used in conjunction with role arn and name
value.name: Session Time

value.description: Name your registered thing in AWS IoT.
value.name: aws.iot.thing

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

value.description: Proxy host name or IP
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: Proxy host port
value.name: Proxy Host Port

referencingComponents.name: Get air condition from lightbox B

value.description: Decide for at most once (0) or at least once (1) message-receiption. Currently AWS IoT does not support QoS-level 2. If no value set the default QoS is 0.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.qos

value.description: MQTT topic to work with. (pattern: $aws/things/mything/shadow/update).
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.topic

value.description: For messages being published, a true setting indicates that the MQTT server should retain a copy of the message. The message will then be transmitted to new subscribers to a topic that matches the message topic. For subscribers registering a new subscription, the flag being true indicates that the received message is not a new one, but one that has been retained by the MQTT server.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.retained

value.description: Your endpoint identifier in AWS IoT (e.g. A1B71MLXKNCXXX)
value.name: aws.iot.endpoint

value.description: Seconds a WebSocket-connection remains open after automatically renewing it. This is neccessary due to Amazon's service limit on WebSocket connection duration. As soon as the limit is changed by Amazon you can adjust the value here. Never use a duration longer than supported by Amazon. This processor renews the connection 20 seconds before the actual expiration. If no value set the default will be 86400.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.keepalive

value.description: MQTT client ID to use. Under the cover your input will be extended by a random string to ensure a unique id among all connected clients.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.client

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

value.description: Name your registered thing in AWS IoT.
value.name: aws.iot.thing

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

value.description: Proxy host name or IP
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: Proxy host port
value.name: Proxy Host Port

referencingComponents.name: Get air condition from lightbox A

value.description: Decide for at most once (0) or at least once (1) message-receiption. Currently AWS IoT does not support QoS-level 2. If no value set the default QoS is 0.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.qos

value.description: MQTT topic to work with. (pattern: $aws/things/mything/shadow/update).
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.topic

value.description: For messages being published, a true setting indicates that the MQTT server should retain a copy of the message. The message will then be transmitted to new subscribers to a topic that matches the message topic. For subscribers registering a new subscription, the flag being true indicates that the received message is not a new one, but one that has been retained by the MQTT server.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.retained

value.description: Your endpoint identifier in AWS IoT (e.g. A1B71MLXKNCXXX)
value.name: aws.iot.endpoint

value.description: Seconds a WebSocket-connection remains open after automatically renewing it. This is neccessary due to Amazon's service limit on WebSocket connection duration. As soon as the limit is changed by Amazon you can adjust the value here. Never use a duration longer than supported by Amazon. This processor renews the connection 20 seconds before the actual expiration. If no value set the default will be 86400.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.keepalive

value.description: MQTT client ID to use. Under the cover your input will be extended by a random string to ensure a unique id among all connected clients.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.client

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

value.description: The name of the server that is running the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Hostname

value.description: The port on the remote server that is to be used when communicating with the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Port

value.description: If specified, indicates the SSL Context Service that is used to communicate with the remote server. If not specified, communications will not be encrypted
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies how long to wait when communicating with the remote server before determining that there is a communications failure if data cannot be sent or received
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: When a FlowFile is added to the cache, this value is stored along with it so that if a duplicate is found, this description of the original FlowFile will be added to the duplicate's "original.flowfile.description" attribute
value.name: FlowFile Description

value.description: Time interval to age off cached FlowFiles
value.name: Age Off Duration

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache unique identifiers, used to determine duplicates
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

value.description: When true this cause the processor to check for duplicates and cache the Entry Identifier. When false, the processor would only check for duplicates and not cache the Entry Identifier, requiring another processor to add identifiers to the distributed cache.
value.name: Cache The Entry Identifier

value.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.
value.name: Database Connection URL

value.description: Database driver class name
value.name: Database Driver Class Name

value.description: Optional database driver jar file path url. For example 'file:///var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'
value.name: Database Driver Jar Url

value.description: Database user name
value.name: Database User

value.description: The password for the database user
value.name: Password

value.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or -1 to wait indefinitely.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.
value.name: Max Total Connections

value.description: Specifies the JDBC Connection Pool to use in order to convert the JSON message to a SQL statement. The Connection Pool is necessary in order to determine the appropriate database column types.
value.name: JDBC Connection Pool

value.description: If true, when a FlowFile is consumed by this Processor, the Processor will first check the fragment.identifier and fragment.count attributes of that FlowFile. If the fragment.count value is greater than 1, the Processor will not process any FlowFile will that fragment.identifier until all are available; at that point, it will process all FlowFiles with that fragment.identifier as a single transaction, in the order specified by the FlowFiles' fragment.index attributes. This Provides atomicity of those SQL statements. If this value is false, these attributes will be ignored and the updates will occur independent of one another.
value.name: Support Fragmented Transactions

value.description: If the <Support Fragmented Transactions> property is set to true, specifies how long to wait for all FlowFiles for a particular fragment.identifier attribute to arrive before just transferring all of the FlowFiles with that identifier to the 'failure' relationship
value.name: Transaction Timeout

value.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to put to the database in a single transaction
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, any key that is automatically generated by the database will be added to the FlowFile that generated it using the sql.generate.key attribute. This may result in slightly slower performance and is not supported by all databases.
value.name: Obtain Generated Keys

labels.label: Communicate with Lightboxes via AWS IoT
Save to MySQL on AWS RDS

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

entry.value: INSERT INTO voting (participantId, senderAlias, text, votedOnA, votedOnB) VALUES (${participantId}, '${From:urlDecode()}', '${Body:replace("'", '')}', ${votedOnA}, ${votedOnB})

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'Content-Type' HTTP Header
value.name: Content-Type

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this Relationship if the Processor is unable to respond to the requestor. This may happen, for instance, if the connection times out or if NiFi is restarted before responding to the HTTP Request.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this Relationship after the response has been successfully sent to the requestor
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

allowableValues.description: The endpoint that provides public data, aka a 'garden hose'
The endpoint that provides access to all tweets
Endpoint that allows the stream to be filtered by specific terms or User IDs

value.description: Specifies which endpoint data should be pulled from
value.name: Twitter Endpoint

value.description: The Consumer Key provided by Twitter
value.name: Consumer Key

value.description: The Consumer Secret provided by Twitter
value.name: Consumer Secret

value.description: The Access Token provided by Twitter
value.name: Access Token

value.description: The Access Token Secret provided by Twitter
value.name: Access Token Secret

value.description: A comma-separated list of languages for which tweets should be fetched
value.name: Languages

value.description: A comma-separated list of terms to filter on. Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'. The filter works such that if any term matches, the status update will be retrieved; multiple terms separated by a space function as an 'AND'. I.e., 'it was, hello' will retrieve status updates that have either 'hello' or both 'it' AND 'was'
value.name: Terms to Filter On

value.description: A comma-separated list of Twitter User ID's to follow. Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'.
value.name: IDs to Follow

value.description: A comma-separated list of coordinates specifying one or more bounding boxes to filter on.Each bounding box is specified by a pair of coordinates in the format: swLon,swLat,neLon,neLat. Multiple bounding boxes can be specified as such: swLon1,swLat1,neLon1,neLat1,swLon2,swLat2,neLon2,neLat2.Ignored unless Endpoint is set to 'Filter Endpoint'.
value.name: Locations to Filter On

relationships.description: All status updates will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

processors.name: Look for vote in received text

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The name of the FlowFile Attribute into which the Hash Value should be written. If the value already exists, it will be overwritten
value.name: Hash Attribute Name

value.description: Determines what hashing algorithm should be used to perform the hashing function
value.name: Hash Algorithm

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be processed successfully will be sent to this relationship without any attribute being added
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that are process successfully will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.description: The character set to use for decoding URL parameters if the HTTP Request does not supply one
value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.description: Allow HTTP GET Method
value.name: Allow GET

value.description: Allow HTTP POST Method
value.name: Allow POST

value.description: Allow HTTP PUT Method
value.name: Allow PUT

value.description: Allow HTTP DELETE Method
value.name: Allow DELETE

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method
value.name: Allow HEAD

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.description: A comma-separated list of non-standard HTTP Methods that should be allowed
value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

relationships.description: All content that is received is routed to the 'success' relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: When a FlowFile is added to the cache, this value is stored along with it so that if a duplicate is found, this description of the original FlowFile will be added to the duplicate's "original.flowfile.description" attribute
value.name: FlowFile Description

value.description: Time interval to age off cached FlowFiles
value.name: Age Off Duration

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache unique identifiers, used to determine duplicates
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

value.description: When true this cause the processor to check for duplicates and cache the Entry Identifier. When false, the processor would only check for duplicates and not cache the Entry Identifier, requiring another processor to add identifiers to the distributed cache.
value.name: Cache The Entry Identifier

relationships.description: If a FlowFile has been detected to be a duplicate, it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: duplicate

relationships.description: If unable to communicate with the cache, the FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: If a FlowFile's Cache Entry Identifier was not found in the cache, it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: non-duplicate

value.description: Name your registered thing in AWS IoT.
value.name: aws.iot.thing

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

value.description: Proxy host name or IP
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: Proxy host port
value.name: Proxy Host Port

processors.name: Get air condition from lightbox B

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Specifies the JDBC Connection Pool to use in order to convert the JSON message to a SQL statement. The Connection Pool is necessary in order to determine the appropriate database column types.
value.name: JDBC Connection Pool

value.description: If true, when a FlowFile is consumed by this Processor, the Processor will first check the fragment.identifier and fragment.count attributes of that FlowFile. If the fragment.count value is greater than 1, the Processor will not process any FlowFile will that fragment.identifier until all are available; at that point, it will process all FlowFiles with that fragment.identifier as a single transaction, in the order specified by the FlowFiles' fragment.index attributes. This Provides atomicity of those SQL statements. If this value is false, these attributes will be ignored and the updates will occur independent of one another.
value.name: Support Fragmented Transactions

value.description: If the <Support Fragmented Transactions> property is set to true, specifies how long to wait for all FlowFiles for a particular fragment.identifier attribute to arrive before just transferring all of the FlowFiles with that identifier to the 'failure' relationship
value.name: Transaction Timeout

value.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to put to the database in a single transaction
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, any key that is automatically generated by the database will be added to the FlowFile that generated it using the sql.generate.key attribute. This may result in slightly slower performance and is not supported by all databases.
value.name: Obtain Generated Keys

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated and retrying the operation will also fail, such as an invalid query or an integrity constraint violation
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated but attempting the operation again may succeed
relationships.name: retry

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after the database is successfully updated
relationships.name: success

value.description: Decide for at most once (0) or at least once (1) message-receiption. Currently AWS IoT does not support QoS-level 2. If no value set the default QoS is 0.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.qos

value.description: MQTT topic to work with. (pattern: $aws/things/mything/shadow/update).
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.topic

value.description: For messages being published, a true setting indicates that the MQTT server should retain a copy of the message. The message will then be transmitted to new subscribers to a topic that matches the message topic. For subscribers registering a new subscription, the flag being true indicates that the received message is not a new one, but one that has been retained by the MQTT server.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.retained

value.description: Your endpoint identifier in AWS IoT (e.g. A1B71MLXKNCXXX)
value.name: aws.iot.endpoint

value.description: Seconds a WebSocket-connection remains open after automatically renewing it. This is neccessary due to Amazon's service limit on WebSocket connection duration. As soon as the limit is changed by Amazon you can adjust the value here. Never use a duration longer than supported by Amazon. This processor renews the connection 20 seconds before the actual expiration. If no value set the default will be 86400.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.keepalive

value.description: MQTT client ID to use. Under the cover your input will be extended by a random string to ensure a unique id among all connected clients.
value.name: aws.iot.mqtt.client

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Name your registered thing in AWS IoT.
value.name: aws.iot.thing

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider
value.name: AWS Credentials Provider service

value.description: Proxy host name or IP
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: Proxy host port
value.name: Proxy Host Port

processors.name: Get air condition from lightbox A

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

entry.value: Thank you for participating in Hadoop Summit Keynote Demo. Lightbox on stage is at ${temperature}°F with humidity of ${humidity}%. Your code is #${participantId}.

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success
